summary: This document outlines the responsibilities and structure of the Americas Reputational Risk Committee (ARRC) at Deutsche Bank, detailing the roles of various members, including the Chairman and other voting members. It emphasizes the importance of identifying and addressing reputational risk issues within the organization.
keyFacts: The ARRC is a sub-committee of the RGB responsible for reputational risk issues.
The General Counsel for the Americas serves as the Chairman of the ARRC.
The committee includes members such as the North America COO, North America CRO, and Head of Americas Compliance.
Guests and advisors may be invited to meetings as needed, including the Head of Government Relations and Public Affairs in the US and Latin America.
There is no set limit to the number of members on the ARRC, but effective membership levels are recognized.
